description: The Wood Thrush is a medium-sized, migratory bird with brown and white plumage and distinctive markings on the chest. It is commonly found in forests, woodlands, and thickets, feeding on insects, spiders, and berries.

coloration: Blue and white plumage with a large bill
description: The Woodland Kingfisher is a medium-sized, migratory bird with blue and white plumage and a large bill. It is commonly found in woodlands, savannas, and open areas, feeding on fish, insects, and small vertebrates.

coloration: Brown and gray plumage with a long tail
description: The Wrentit is a small, non-migratory bird with brown and gray plumage and a long tail. It is commonly found in chaparral, scrublands, and thickets, feeding on insects, spiders, and berries.

coloration: Yellow and black plumage with a curved bill
description: The Yellow-Bellied Flowerpecker is a small, non-migratory bird with yellow and black plumage and a curved bill. It is commonly found in forests, gardens, and flowering trees, feeding on nectar, fruits, and small insects.

coloration: Yellow and olive-green plumage with a white spectacles mark
description: The Yellow-Breasted Chat is a medium-sized, migratory bird with yellow and olive-green plumage and a white spectacles mark. It is commonly found in thickets, shrublands, and marshes, feeding on insects, berries, and small fruits.

coloration: Yellow and black plumage with a long tail
description: The Yellow Cacique is a medium-sized bird with yellow and black plumage and a long tail. It is non-migratory and can be found in tropical rainforests, woodlands, and savannas, feeding on fruits, insects, and small vertebrates.

coloration: Black body with a yellow head and chest
description: The Yellow-Headed Blackbird is a medium-sized, migratory bird with a black body and a yellow head and chest. It is commonly found in wetlands, marshes, and lakeshores, feeding on seeds, insects, and small invertebrates.

coloration: Brown and beige plumage with distinctive black and white stripes on the neck
description: The Zebra Dove is a small, non-migratory bird with brown and beige plumage and distinctive black and white stripes on the neck. It is commonly found in urban areas, gardens, and parks, feeding on seeds, grains, and small insects.
